item.title: R to @LydiaCaradonna: And before anyone is a smart ass and slides in to try and show up the prossie for not being a real scientist, the source is WHO ‚Äúthe most reported clinical presentation is of localized rash, particularly around the genitals and anus‚Äù https://www.who.int/europe/news/item/10-06-2022-monkeypox-q-a---what-you-need-to-know-about-monkeypox

item.title: R to @LydiaCaradonna: There have been cases presenting with only ONE small lesion/spot/blister/sore. It‚Äôs always better to get something checked out üíñ

item.title: MONKEYPOX - all of the resources are saying to look out for a rash especially on the face, and this is true in general, but the majority of clinical presentations in Europe have been rashes on the genital area. Do not ignore a new rash, sore or lesion ANYWHERE on your body!
item.dc:creator: @LydiaCaradonna
item.description: MONKEYPOX - all of the resources are saying to look out for a rash especially on the face, and this is true in general, but the majority of clinical presentations in Europe have been rashes on the genital area. Do not ignore a new rash, sore or lesion ANYWHERE on your body!

item.title: R to @peachynotkeen: Will answer here! High alcohol antibac stuff is effective against viruses but not 100%. The most important thing is to make sure you wash things in a high heat, but both doesn't hurt. Vaccine can't get yet in the UK unless ur a high risk MSM because risk is so low
